events.name: Intro to Web Dev, Front-end workshop with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
events.description: Learn the basics of web development with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. No prior experience required! You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: DEV Talk: Chris Pinchot
events.description: Chris Pinchot, CTO of Status, an e-commerce startup, will be talking about web development, his career as a software engineer, and entrepreneurship.

events.name: Intro to Full-Stack Web Dev, workshop with Node.js
events.description: Learn how to build a full-stack web application with Node.js. Basic knowledge of JavaScript from the Intro to Web Dev workshop is recommended. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: Cloud Computing Workshop
events.description: Learn how to deploy a web application to the cloud with AWS/Azure/Google Cloud. We will also go over some GitHub. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: Python Workshop
events.description: Learn the basics of Python, a popular programming language used in data science, web development, and more. No experience required, but some programming experience in any language is recommended. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: DEV Talk: Camryn Friedman
events.description: Camryn Friedman, an OSU CSE alumna, currently works as a Back-End Developer for the global consulting firm, Avanade, Inc. Since graduating, Camryn has capitalized on multiple opportunities for personal and professional growth and will be sharing her exciting journey from a student to a Full-Time engineer, and how Avanade has helped her achieve success.

events.name: Computer Science Social
events.description: Come hang out with other students and student organizations on campus! There will be free food and games. A collaborative event with Competitive Programming Club, Cyber Security Club, OHI/O, Google Developer Student Club, and INFORMS.

events.name: JavaScript for Front-End Workshop
events.description: Learn advanced features of JavaScript and how to use them to build a front-end web application. You will learn about JS runtimes, API requests, asynchronous programming, intervals, and more. Basic knowledge of JavaScript from the Intro to Web Dev workshop is recommended. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: React Native - Mobile App Development Workshop
events.description: In this introductory React Native workshop, you will learn the basics of React Native, including its component-based architecture, and build a simple cross-platform application. The workshop will guide you through the development of a basic weather application, and you will be able to run your code on an iOS or Android device. This workshop will give you a starting basis to build your own mobile app. JavaScript knowledge is recommended. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: Rapid MVP Development - No Code Workshop - Collab with Business Builders Club
events.description: Learn how to build a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for your startup idea without writing a single line of code. This workshop will teach you how to use no-code tools to build a website and backend for your startup idea. You can also win $100 prize! You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: Google AI Mastery Workshop
events.description: Learn how to use Google's new Gemini API to create chatbots. You will learn the basics of Google Cloud AI products and prompt design. You will need a google account and a laptop.

events.name: Intro to Quantitative Research
events.description: JJ St. Leroux is an incoming quantitative research intern at Capstone Investment Advisors who is joining DEV to give a lecture on what being a ‚Äúquant‚Äù looks like at each stage in a financial firm. He will discuss the complete life cycle of a quantitative strategy, from designing Financial Information Systems to deploying an investment strategy. At the end, he will discuss interviews for various quant firms and how you can kickstart a career in the industry!

events.name: Personal Portfolio Website Workshop with ACM-W
events.description: Learn how to learn how to create your own portfolio website which showcases your projects and achievements to employers. You will learn the basics of HTML and will deploy your website through GitHub pages. This workshop will be a collaboration with ACM-W. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: How to Win a Hackathon
events.description: Learn from this year's 1st place HackOH/O winners how to prepare for a hackathon, form a team, select the project, and implement your ideas in a short timeframe. With a case study on their winning project, gain insights into pivoting strategies, stack recommendations, and task distribution.

events.name: Computer Science Social
events.description: Join us for our second, spring CS Social! Come hang out with other students and student organizations on campus! There will be free food and games. A collaborative event with Competitive Programming Club, Collaborative Software Development Club, Game Creation Club, AI Club, and Code 4 Community.

events.name: DEV Talk: Malik Alnakhaleh, Software Developer & AI/ML Expert at Nationwide
events.description: "You‚Äôve probably learned a lot about Computer Science and Engineering during your time at OSU, and that‚Äôs good, but it‚Äôs not the whole picture. Let‚Äôs sit down and have a casual chat about how to get into tech, sharing tips and real-life advice on breaking into in the industry, regardless of your background."

events.name: Concluding meeting
events.description: Talk to the officers and other members about what you were working on, share your feedback about the club, and discuss the club‚Äôs vision for the next semester(s). We will have lots of free drinks, so you should consider coming!

events.name: Initial Meeting
events.description: Welcome to DEV! We will introduce the club, its officers, and meet you in-person for the first time this year! We will also discuss the events planned, as well as the projects and how you can get involved.

events.name: Networking Workshop
events.description: This talk will provide practical tips on choosing the right events, making genuine connections, and staying in touch over time. You‚Äôll leave with a clear plan to develop your networking skills and become an active part of the tech community. Presented by Tiana Silva - Tech Elevator graduate and Full Stack Developer at OCLC.

events.name: IGS Energy Employer Roundtable
events.description: Join us for a roundtable discussion with IGS Energy Executives and Engineers. They will discuss their experiences working in the tech industry and how to succeed in the field, as well as talk in depth about IGS and how you can apply for their internships (wink wink).
events.location: Ohio Union 3020C (Interfaith Prayer and Reflection Room)

events.name: Intro to Web Dev Workshop: JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
events.description: Learn the basics of web development with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. No prior experience required! You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: The GitHub Workshop
events.description: Discover how Git and GitHub work, how to use and collaborate in repos. No prior experience required! You will need a GitHub account and a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: How to Win a Hackathon
events.description: Learn from last year's 1st place HackOH/O winners how to prepare for a hackathon, form a team, select the project, and implement your ideas in a short timeframe. Enjoy free pizza and amazing opportunity to build your team for the upcoming HackOHI/0 2024

events.name: Intro to Full-Stack Web Dev with Node.js
events.description: Learn about making API calls, building a web server, and creating interactive web experiences with modern technologies. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: React.js Workshop
events.description: Explore one of the most popular JavaScript frameworks, how components and reactivity work, and why you should or shouldn‚Äôt use it. Some JavaScript knowledge suggested. You will need a Windows/Mac/Linux laptop.

events.name: Computer Science Social
events.description: Join us for our third, fall CS Social! Come hang out with other students and student organizations on campus! There will be free food and games. A collaborative event with ACM-W, OHI/O, IEEE, Competitive Programming Club, and Women in Cybersecurity.

events.name: Test event
events.description: This is a test event.
